page.title: 18House & Road Names:Gringley
page.content: {'ROOD HOUSE'}:means 'Holy Cross House' connected with cross on 'Cross Hill'? {'TOPSEY-TURVEY'}:on Little Lane;living rooms upstairs,bedrooms downstairs. {'THE HOMESTEAD'}:Homestead Farm could be seen from it.Fm. since demolished. {'PIPER'S ROOST'}:field next door named 'Piper's Croft' belongs to Thomson's. Other names include:'Prospect House', 'Belgrave Cottage','Fair View','Sunny Bank','Rose Bank'& 'Blairgowrie'. {'HORSEWELLS ST.'}:part of well remains just above ground level;former resting place for horses climbing up the hill. {'PIT LANE'}:remains of clay pit in field at end of it. {'GREEN LANE'}:before dual carriageway it led to small green and pond. {'LAYCOCK AVE'}:(council housing)after Sir Joseph Laycock of Wiseton Hall. {'HUNTERS DRIVE'}:after the late Harry Hunter,long-serving Parish Councillor.
